main event: A lumber operator and his wife observed a silvery unidentified object hovering in the sky near Harrisville, Michigan on September 23, 1952.
interesting points: The object was described as being about the size of a car and was hovering at an altitude of approximately 1,000 feet., The witness reported that there was no sound at all during the observation., The object suddenly moved away at a very high speed, far faster than any known aircraft., The object appeared to be a smooth, shiny, metallic silver without any visible lights or exhaust., The sighting lasted for approximately 11 minutes before the object accelerated quickly and disappeared from view.
sighted object: a silvery metallic object in the sky
